item.title: VOLUNTEERS NEEDED FOR MALARIA VACCINE STUDIES
item.description:
VOLUNTEERS NEEDED FOR MALARIA VACCINE STUDIES 

 Trying to think of a New Year’s resolution?  Why not join the bid to cure malaria? The Institute for Glycomics is calling for volunteers to be part of their malaria vaccine trials in 2016 on the Gold Coast. Institute for Glycomics Research Fellow and clinical trials coordinator Dr Danielle Stanisic said her malaria vaccine research team led by Professor Michael Good was calling for volunteers to enable the vaccine to progress to the next stage of development. Glycomics. The Laboratory for Vaccines of the Developing World “There are currently 198 million cases of malaria across 109 different countries.

item.title: HOW UNIVERSITIES FIT INTO THE PARIS CLIMATE AGREEMENT
item.description:
HOW UNIVERSITIES FIT INTO THE PARIS CLIMATE AGREEMENT

A landmark agreement to cut the world’s reliance on fossil fuels and thus slow the pace of global warming presents an important opportunity for universities, says Griffith University’s Professor Brendan Mackey.

item.title: GIVING A CRAP: SANITATION A BASIC FUNCTION BUT A COMPLEX ISSUE
item.description:
GIVING A CRAP: SANITATION A BASIC FUNCTION BUT A COMPLEX ISSUE

Know More:Centre for Population and Environmental Health

In most situations and places, toilets and defecation are taboo topics for discussion. They are at the bottom of the list of topics for dinner table conversations.
